You'll have to bear with me for this one, because the press release we received for Demeo X Dungeons & Dragons: Battlemarked contains about an 86/14 split between scrambled hypeguff and actual tangible information. In brief, it's a VR collaboration between D&D traffickers Wizards Of The Coast and Demeo studio Resolution Games that aims to simulate a tactical co-op tabletop experience without any of the boring bits, like seeing your mates' genuine reactions to things or having your frigid digitised soul warmed at the hearth of human kinship. Here is - in a sense of the word so loose I fear imminent smiting by a bellicose scribe god for typing it - a trailer:
Read more
articles.title: Demeo X Dungeons & Dragons: Battlemarked is a VR tabletop tactics game from Wizards Of The Coast

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
Nic says that RPG remake sequel Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth is "uneven, unfocused, and unmissable". You also can’t miss its regular performance hiccups, which most often manifest as little but frequent stutters that occur as you’re moseying around its poorly planet. 
Or can you? News comes via Nic himself that modder FrancisLouis, whose previous works include performance-enhancing rejigs of various games (and one that turns the Silent Hill 2 remake’s pipe weapon into a rigid, A-posing wife), has produced Fantasy Optimizer: an overhaul of how FF7 Rebirth handles shaders and streamed visuals. Both Nic and myself have tried it out on our respective rigs, and it works! Mostly.
Read more
articles.title: Try this mod to calm Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth’s stuttering on PC

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
Has any genus of graphics card been as dramatically storied as the GeForce XX80s? The RTX 3080 was a thing of beauty, only to be tarnished by the worst wheeler-dealing spree (and crypto mining misappropriation) in PC component history. Then the RTX 4080 rocked up with its laughable £1269 / $1199 price tag, a miscalculation so severe that the RTX 4080 Super looked good – despite hardly being any faster – simply for not repeating it. For the new RTX 5080’s sake, you almost want it to be boring.
It isn’t. But then, neither is it a blood-boiler like the RTX 4080, nor a largely aspirational show-off piece like the RTX 5090. By maintaining the 4080 Super’s course correction on price while tooling up on compelling DLSS 4 improvements, the RTX 5080 is an agreeable GPU from the off. Particularly, if you’ve got the 4K monitor to take full advantage of it.
Read more
articles.title: Nvidia GeForce RTX 5080 review: the new 4K graphics card to go for

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
I cherish my fairly sharp memories of the 2016 launch version of No Man's Sky, inasmuch as the contrast renders the latest additions to the wistful space game all the more dazzling. Dazzling and exhausting. What was once a relatively (and to some extent unintentionally) lean procgen exploration sim has swelled into a game of mechs, fishing, fickle weather systems, intricate asteroid engagements, starbases, nautiloids and capes. It is far bigger than it reasonably needs to be, and it's only getting more and more, er, infinite.
Read more
articles.title: New No Man's Sky update adds walkable gas giants among "trillions" of new planets, just in case you were running out

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Friend, I regret to inform you that ant nests are computers now. Which is to say, somebody's finally made a video game version of Hex, the sentient glass hive from Terry Pratchett's Unseen University. In spooky automation-driven strategy sim Microtopia, you manage a swarm of what could either be ants who've been to the ripperdoc, or PC components who've grown legs and antennae. Your goal is to expand an insect colony that is also a motherboard, where glittering pheromone trails double as silicon circuits.
The developers Cordyceps Collective have just announced a release date - February 18th - and what's this, there's a demo as well? Catch the trailer below.

 
Read more
articles.title: Eerie robot insect colony sim Microtopia launches in February, with 'programmable' ants

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Sniper At Work is the work of Cherrypick Games, hitherto known for "soothing merge-2 experiences" featuring puppy-eyed princes. The only "twos" you shall be "merging" in Sniper At Work are bullets and faces. The only "cherries" you shall be "picking" are hoodlums in sore need of a skullful of lead. The only princes you shall acknowledge are their royal highnesses Distance, Wind, and Timing.
You may or may not find all that "soothing" - I won't judge. I will only repeat Nic's observation from the Maw that Sniper At Work look "a bit like Commandos, a bit like Hitman", which I would translate to "my comrade in PC gaming, if historic audience trends are any indication you shall do well here". Right, that's enough quotation marks for one article. There won't be any left for the next interview feature at this rate. Here's the trailer.
 Read more
articles.title: Sniper At Work is a game of crafty first-person assassination with a touch of Hitman's sandboxing

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Are those ripples in your morning cappuccino? Must be the stomping feet of an ancient lizard messing up that nice whippy heart your barista made in the froth. And when I say "ancient" I mean from 1999. Dino Crisis and Dino Crisis 2 have appeared on GOG, making the classic survival horror games easily (and legally) playable on the PC once again.
Read more
articles.title: Dino Crisis and Dino Crisis 2 get re-released on PC via GOG, but that probably won't sate fans dying for a remake

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Peripeteia feels like what I'd get if I asked a wasp to describe Deus Ex to me. It has sharp, insectoid qualities. Unwelcoming but oddly comfortable in its rusty soviet Ozymandism. The first sign of sentient life this immersive sim offers me is the greeting of a gasmasked freakdroid as I leave a warehouse. Tinny propaganda songs play from TVs too big to comfortably fit in anyone's car. The warehouse is so huge I thought it was outside until I looked up and there was writing on the sky and I realised it was a roof. I'm still messed up about it, honestly.
Read more
articles.title: Peripeteia is perpetual pit of immersive sim despair dripping with post-Soviet bleakness, out in early access next month

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Today is release day for The Game Kitchen's The Stone Of Madness, an isometric tactical stealth game set in an 18th century monastery - "isometric tactical stealth game" being a pretty clinical way to describe the plight of sundry lost souls exploring a maze of hellish Catholic art populated by guards and ghouls. 
 
Read more
articles.title: Monastery escape tactics sim The Stone Of Madness is out now and has me thinking about time

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Did you have a tamagotchi as a kid? I did, and yes, I too let it die. I am thankful that the handheld LCD graphics of the era did not allow me to witness my companion blob's amiable decline into shit-caked starvation. I am also thankful that my tamagotchi did not itself have a tamagotchi, because the only life principle I ever taught my tamagotchi was neglect. This is also the reason I may never play the reportedly pretty decent virtual pet game Yoke Heroes: A Long Tamago, whose developers 14 Hours Productions are defying God and Man by developing another virtual pet sim inside it.
 
Read more
articles.title: Creator of already-disturbing elf-hatching sim now plots to make another virtual pet game inside it

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
The Sims and The Sims 2 are getting digital PC versions with all their original expansion packs included, and should be released by the end of the week, say Kotaku. The report follows teases made by the official Sims account on X as part of a 25th anniversary celebrations roadmap, as well as a few other scattered hints in various bits of promo as collated by Redditor skyline7284. "According to a source familiar with the plans, both games will be released digitally on PC later this week," write Kotaku.
Read more
articles.title: The Sims 1 and 2 are coming back to PC this week with all original expansion packs, says report

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Outside The Blocks is a diorama building game so beautiful I was initially distrustful of it, as if it was some sort of dazzling carnivorous plant trying to lure me in to munch on my hands. I've had a play of the Steam demo now, and am happy to report that it's still very beautiful, and also that I still have hands: an incredible victory on all counts.
Read more
articles.title: Outside The Blocks is a gorgeous diorama sculptor that had its developer travel Europe for architectural references

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
The developers of free-to-play monster hunting game Dauntless have laid off "the majority of the studio" less than two months after the game's troubled launch on Steam. "Today is another difficult day at Phoenix Labs," said the company in a post on LinkedIn, which called the sweeping layoffs "part of unfortunate but necessary changes to our operations." It's the fourth time in two years that the studio has seen job cuts. 
Read more
articles.title: "Majority" of Dauntless developers laid off two months after disastrous Steam launch wiped all player progress

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
The Marvel Rivals community was briefly awash with rumours than publisher NetEase were playing 4D chess with their hero-loving hearts last week, according to a new report by Michael Cripe for Ian Games The rumours began in a Discord for the team shooter named Marvel Rivals Leaks, where user Keone speculated that NetEase were seeding fake information on upcoming heroes for dataminers to find.
Read more
articles.title: Conspiracy was briefly afoot in the Marvel Rivals community following NetEase hero plant rumours

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Painkiller, Bulletstorm, and Outriders studio People Can Fly will be co-developing Gears Of War: E-Day, the upcoming shooter in the long-running series of games about large men doing large violence at large bugs from behind medium walls. This is good news! People Can Fly have a pedigree for serving chunky gun chutney with a smile. They've also worked extensively on the series before, notably Judgement Day. E-Day itself is aiming to have a pronounced horror slant, with the 'Emergence Day' of the title referring to the insectoid Locust's first visit above ground.  
Read more
articles.title: Bulletstorm and Painkiller devs People Can Fly to co-develop Gears of War: E-Day, following spate of layoffs and cancellations last year

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
In regular Darkest Dungeon 2, your mind, body and soul are fixed upon the points of a horrible mountain, looming over the inn at the end of every foetid wagon ride. It's sort of Journey for plague doctors, or possibly The Hobbit: Cosmodick Turpin Edition. I enjoy feeling the weight of those distant peaks upon my brain and eyeballs, but it's nice to fire up Kingdoms, the new free DD2 game mode that's launched just today, and have a choice of disasters to trundle toward.  


Over here is an inn being overrun by slathering beastmen. Over there is another, safer inn, but it's inconveniently perched behind a nest of tentacular cultists. In the middle there is you, with the customary DD party of half-dead, half-mad adventurers, equipped with an exciting smorgasbord of sharp edges, cursed artefacts, phobias and diseases. Let us proceed laughing and wailing to the launch trailer.
 
Read more
articles.title: Darkest Dungeon 2's free Kingdoms mode is out now, and it's got its red hooks in me already

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Assassin's Creed publishers Ubisoft are making another round of layoffs as part of wider efforts to persuade their investors to stop yelling at them. They're letting 185 people go across their European operations, and will be closing UK-based Ubisoft Leamington, whose recent projects include supporting development of Star Wars Outlaws and Skull And Bones. All this less than two months after jettisoning the hundreds of people who worked on free-to-play shooter XDefiant. 
 
Read more
articles.title: Ubisoft lay off another 185 people and shutter one of the studios behind Star Wars: Outlaws and The Division 2

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Look up, planet-lubber. Space Engineers 2 launches into the starry depths of early access today, although it is currently limited to a single player creative mode. It's the sequel to the sci-fi shipbuilding game we quite enjoyed here at RPS. At this early alpha stage, the not-yet-a-survival-game invites players to create galleons of the galaxy, block by shiny metal block, and then drive those ships into one another at 300 metres per second. 
Read more
articles.title: Space Engineers 2 whooshes out of the airlock and into the cold dark void of early access

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Today I learned about balut, a street food of the Philippines. It's a fertilized duck egg, boiled or steamed, in which you can still see the duck embryo as you munch. I'm too old to discover this acquired taste on a gap year, but I'm not too old to waltz down the horror aisle in Itch.io, throwing retro jumpscarers into my basket. Which is where first-person Filipino suspense game Hapunan can be found. You play a young street food vendor hawking the eggs on a quiet corner late at night. Naturally, something alarming is afoot. There is talk on the radio of dangerous folk out at night...
Read more
articles.title: Filipino horror game Hapunan is about escaping police brutality and selling fertilised duck eggs

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
It's been a veritable Koei Tecmo offensive on PC recently - the kind one could only reasonably attribute to a flurry of panic over stock prices (boring, bad) or else a sheer compulsion to drown us in lots of very agile men with very sharp swords (fun and good). First, there was Dynasty Warriors: Origins, which I enjoyed quite a bit. Then Ninja Gaiden 2 Black got a surprise release. Now, we're getting Team Ninja's Rise Of The Ronin this coming March - the 11th to be precise. I'd do a bit about stealth drops but I'm at the point where using game-thematic verbs makes me want to collapse on a bed of caltrops, throat first. Here's a trailer:
Read more
articles.title: Team Ninja's Rise Of The Ronin simply cannot resist the allure of PC, arrives on Steam in March

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
I reckon you're likely to be in one of two camps with precision platformer Bauhaus Bonk - which I instantly appreciate for giving me an excuse to use the word "bopping" -  either finding it so easy you wonder what the point is, or getting genuinely sucked in by its deceptive trickiness. It's a single-button affair, having you navigate levels by alternating a pivot-point on a shape I don't know the name of so I'm just going to call a spinny stick.
There are moving background elements in some stages - in others, you make your own pace. Except I can't really make my own pace, can I Bauhaus Bonk? Because the swing soundtrack makes me feel like a plodding buffoon if I'm not responding with appropriate gusto. This is entrapment, game. I am devilishly compelled by swing, like a Reefer Madness extra.
Read more
articles.title: Bauhaus Bonk is an energetic, lethal single-button arcade game set to a bopping swing soundtrack

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Pogs are something I never consciously think about until something reminds me of Pogs, at which time I am instantly very excited about Pogs. The latest reminder being Snow Town Geek Store, a shopkeeping sim brimming with 2000's non-tude. Like the 2000's themselves, it feels both alive with promise and liable to turn bad at any moment. But I do very much enjoy both its energy and soundtrack, based on what little information is currently available. A tray-tray for you, the discerning tray-tray viewer:
Read more
articles.title: Play Pogs, do crime in Y2K convenience shop sim Snow Town Geek Store

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Continuing last week's Maw merchandising roll-out, may I introduce by popular demand the first official Maw-endorsed letter opener. Now now, don't act coy! I know some of you are old enough to know what a letter opener is, or even to own one. Statistically, most of the RPS readership are Lich Lords. The Maw letter opener differs from regular letter openers in that when you open a letter with it, you will encounter not a letter but a perfect copy of yourself opening a letter in the opposite direction. The two of you must now fight to the death to decide who is the letter-opener and who is the letter. It's yours for a piffling three pints of any available body fluid, but if you don't want to buy a letter opener you can always buy one of this week's new PC games instead.
 
Read more
articles.title: The Maw: what's new in PC games this week?

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Could we perhaps chart the entire course of technological innovation as a story of things not fitting in other things quite as well as some reckless genius had hoped? Something to ponder on, perhaps, as we behold the Steam Brick. As reported by PC Gamer, one Crastinator-pro has documented their journey to transform the Steam Deck into a controller-less, screen-less creature of ineffable bricktitude. Why? Because the Deck didn't fit in their backpack.
Read more
articles.title: Behold, the Steam Brick

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
After making headlines last December for what was, in context, an entirely fair and even-handed request to Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth modders to "not to create or install anything offensive or inappropriate," director Naoki Hamaguchi was recently asked to clarify his stance by Automaton.
Read more
articles.title: Final Fantasy VII Rebirth director thinks mods "breathe life into the PC market", following previous request to please not give Cait Sith a dump truck ass

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Sundays are for playing some video games, I think? Seems unlikely but let's find out.

Jonathan Nash died. That name might not mean anything to you, but Nash was a writer for the much-beloved British games mag Amiga Power in the '90s, and he was influential on the generation of games writers that followed - including several founders of this website. RPS co-founder Kieron Gillen wrote about what made J Nash unique in his newsletter:

 
Read more
articles.title: The Sunday Papers

articles.author: Ollie Toms
articles.description:
It's been a busy week of prep here in the treehouse! At least, I assume so. Nothing's broken or in flames around me, so I can only assume we're waiting for the next big thing to break down or burst into flames. In the interim, here's what we'll be clicking on this weekend!
 Read more
articles.title: What are we all playing this weekend?

articles.author: Robert Anderson
articles.description:
Doom is back, and this time it’s bringing its signature blend of demon-slaying chaos and heavy-metal energy to medieval times. Doom: The Dark Ages launches on May 15 for PC, Xbox Series X|S, and PS5—unless you’re eyeing one of the pricier editions, which grant early access starting May 13. Naturally, our attention is on the PC edition and, of course, where to get it for the best price.
 Read more
articles.title: Doom: The Dark Ages gets a big discount on PC if you pre-order today, here’s how to secure the deal

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
My favourite genre of YouTuber is: "person who hyperfixates on one mundane detail of a blockbuster video game and gets strangely poetic about it".  When you offer me a five-hour video essay about an obscure adventure game from 1998, I will hide in the closet. But if you idly wonder where the rivers in Skyrim go, I will follow along dutifully like a baby elephant. This is how I ended up spending much of my afternoon watching David Cage characters pissing. One video creator decided to painstakingly count every instance of playable pee time in cinematic adventure game Heavy Rain. This is vital work. This is important work.
Read more
articles.title: Finally, someone investigated how many times you can piss in Heavy Rain

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Here's your feelgood story for the weekend, possibly: the creators of megahit Palworld are using some of their Palbucks to set up a new publishing arm, and their first project as publisher is an untitled horror game from Surgent Studios, the struggling developers of Tales Of Kenzera: ZAU.
 
Read more
articles.title: Palworld's creators are paying the Kenzera devs to make a horror game about the entertainment industry

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
A performance and settings guide for a ropey PC port of a Final Fantasy game? Sweet, I haven’t done one of these in four whole months. In fairness to Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth, which Nic says can be great as a game per se, it does make some effort at settling into Windows. It has rebindable M+K controls. It has DLSS. It has generally more consistent framerates than FFXVI, which could bait you in with silky visuals before grabbing your head and shoving it into the cold ice bath of sub-30fps.
Yet it also steps back from that game on its supported tech, while raising its hardware requirements so far above Final Fantasy 7 Remake that it won’t even launch on a lot of older graphics cards. Even so, hitching and microstuttering issues from FF7 Remake return once more, along with plenty of other signs that this PC version didn’t get the love that a lot of other erstwhile PlayStation exclusives – like Horizon Forbidden West or God of War Ragnarök – did for their ports.
Read more
articles.title: Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth continues the series' streak of iffy PC ports

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
If you turn 33 years old in the next couple of months then, sorry, you are dead. I don't make the rules, that's just how Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 explains the lack of elders in its very French yet very JRPG world. The fantasy game will see you journey across a dangerous landscape to stop the mad "paintress" who's magically culling humanity at younger and younger ages every year. We've been keeping a weary middle-aged eye on its development, and yesterday it got a release date. It's too late for most of us in the RPS treehouse. But watch the trailer for yourself, maybe you'll make it. 
Read more
articles.title: The mad artiste of Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 paints a release date for the Persona-like RPG

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
How many times can video games riff on that one Dr Who episode with the weeping statues? At least once more. Surgeon Simulator devs Bossa have just announced Don't Get Got, in which you and up to seven of your so-called friends are trapped in a large school with randomised objectives and safe rooms. Also in the school: a bunch of horrifying little boys in shorts and braces.


It's out in early access today. Yes, they've sprung this one on us like a ghastly Jack-in-the-box. Steady your nerves and watch the trailer.
 
Read more
articles.title: In Don't Get Got you try to escape a school full of freaky little guys and worst of all, your friends

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Good news for anyone eager to meet a big talking catfish. A new trailer for action adventure game South Of Midnight sees players battering monsters from the folklore of the US' Deep South. It shows hero Hazel arguing with her mum before a supernatural hurricane cuts off the family drama and sends Hazel wandering the swamps to encounter giant alligators, giant fish, giant dolls, and giant people. Maybe Hazel is just very small. Either way, it also dangles an important morsel in front of our snapping jaws: a release date. Come see.
Read more
articles.title: The big fish in swampy adventure South Of Midnight baits us with a release date

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Team Ninja and Koei Tecmo have surprise-released Ninja Gaiden 2: Black, an Unreal Engine 5 version of Xbox 360 hack-and-slasher Ninja Gaiden 2. It's out right now on Steam and Microsoft's Game Pass service. I'd say it has materialised from the darkness like a ninja, but there are a lot of ninjas in circulation at the minute, and my analogy-jitsu gauge is running dry. So instead, I'm going to say that it has materialised from the darkness like a resurfacing duck, its beak stuffed with pond vegetation. The pond vegetation, here, stands for "tweaks to the weapons upgrade system". Here's a trailer.
 Read more
articles.title: Koei Tecmo surprise-release Ninja Gaiden 2 Black, "definitive" Unreal remaster of the 2008 hack-and-slash

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Typical, really. I get all excited about sharing details from a preview event for upcoming FPS Doom: The Dark Ages, then it turns out the gameplay reveal video is going public before the embargo anyway. Then the alleged release date allegedly leaks, allegedly. How am I supposed to present myself as a font of knowledge now, Id? Fortunately, we had a roundtable interview afterward with executive producer Marty Stratton and game director Hugo Martin. Sweet, job-justifying details!
Writing up the interview in full would involve typing out the words "awesome", "slaughter", "core pillars", and "iPod" more times than anyone realistically needs to read. Instead, here's a list of every detail I found interesting that isn't already covered in the showcase. 
Read more
articles.title: Doom: The Dark Ages is out May 15th, 2025. Here's everything we learned from Id's press show

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
We called Amplitude's fiendish and fanciful strategy game Endless Legend the best 4X of 2014, and its hexcellence hasn't dimmed with age. "The music, the amazing variety in terrain and units, the sheer quantity of words bringing to life every last quest, minor faction, creature, and environmental anomaly," breathed a reverential Ollie in 2023. "It's a simply splendid game." Like somebody commenting on the sturdiness of an original Picasso's frame, I will only add that it now runs pretty comfortably on the current least expensive Dell Thinkpad.
Why in Meier's name would Sega choose to sell off the studio behind such a worldly wonder? The answer is lost in time (it's through that link, there), but fortunately, Amplitude endure as an independent - and they've just announced Endless Legend 2 with no less than Hooded Horse as publisher. Here's the announcement trailer.
 Read more
articles.title: Amplitude announce Endless Legend 2, an oceanic 4X with Manor Lords outfit Hooded Horse as publisher

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Team Ninja and Koei Tecmo have announced Ninja Gaiden 4, the first new numbered entry in the bloodthirsty third-person action series since 2012. Trailered at this evening's Xbox Developer Direct, it releases for PC in fall 2025, and they're working on it in collaboration with Bayonetta and Nier: Automata devs Platinum Games. All of which very much tickles my dismemberable gizzards. Here's the reveal video.
 
Read more
articles.title: Team Ninja announce Ninja Gaiden 4, and they're getting help from Platinum

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
Assassin's Creed Shadows has a lot riding on it. Between its multiple release date delays in response to Star Wars Outlaws not selling as well as Ubisoft would've liked, and Ubi potentially being bought by Tencent as they clamour for help, there's a sense that Shadows needs to deliver not only a great game, but corporate redemption.
I've now played Shadows for four hours, having dipped into a bit of prologue action, some open world exploration, and a questline as both the hulking Yasuke and the lithe Naoe. Have Ubi delivered? I think there's a strong chance. What I played was a lot of comforting Creeding, carried along by a gorgeous interpretation of Edo Japan, and some subtle tweaks to up stealth stakes. Although I do think the two protagonists are a split personality that doesn't quite work for me.
Read more
articles.title: I enjoyed my time with Assassin's Creed Shadows, but I remain unconvinced by its split protagonists

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Where were you on October 11th last year? If you were Edwin, Brendy, or myself - which, statistically, you are not - you were writing news articles about one of three aspirant spiritual successors to detective RPG Disco Elysium. It was an "I'm Spartacus"-ass day of press releases, culminating in the announcement of a project from former ZA/UM writers Argo Tuulik and Olga Moskvina.
Before that came sci-fi RPG XXX Nightshift, and before that was an unnamed "psychogeographic RPG" from newly formed Longdue. We now know that it's called Hopetown, and Longdue are set to launch a crowdfunding campaign which you can "pre-register" for here, should you wish. Here's the sell:
Read more
articles.title: The psychogeography-est of Disco Elysium's spiritual successors is a gonzo journalism RPG named Hopetown

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 is billed as a faithful recreation of 15th century Bohemia, with an open world setting derived from primary sources and historical consultancy that seeks to "challenge misconceptions", but I'm enjoying it partly for the inconsistencies. As I amble into a random village, my eye is caught by what feel like carefully observed period flourishes: a particular arrangement of crops in a sloping field, a woman praying at a shrine by the gate. Some of these sights and sounds unlock codex entries, layering up the pedagogic texture. 
 
Read more
articles.title: The Gamergator rhetoric of historical accuracy has come back to bite Kingdom Come on the arse

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Few games place me so betwixt the yin and yang of frustration and flow state as Snow Riders. Here is a compact selection of ski slopes, each one yodeling the promise of my smooth and exhilarating descent over fresh powder. But wait, someone has littered this Ski Sunday with obstacles, forcing me to run a gauntlet of trees, rocks and rivers. I am thrust headlong into each of these obstacles a dozen times before my withered synapses and tired bones internalise these arboreal teachings and I make it safely to the bottom.

As in life, there is joy to be found in this journey precisely because it is hard. Unlike in life, the camera is often facing backwards while you do it.

 
Read more
articles.title: Lonely Mountains: Snow Riders review - cross-country skiing as rewarding for the journey as the destination

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Dwarf Fortress's Adventure mode - a procedurally generated campaign that lets you approach the famously dense colony sim like a more traditional roguelite - is now out as a free update on Steam. The game represents perhaps the most cavernous, yawping blind spot in my entire pile of shame. I do own it, but I'm yet to play. I've already read a great deal of extended wordery on its merits - please, sell it to me in the comments in seven words or less. Here's a trailer:
Read more
articles.title: Dwarf Fortress Steam edition's Adventure Mode is out today

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
Readers, I have spent two full days in the benchmark pits to tell you what you've already guessed: the GeForce RTX 5090 is very fast, too expensive, and laden with more AI tech than Philip K. Dick’s cheese dreams. At least two of those points will, I’m sure, send the average graphics card shopper running, especially at a time when even game developers are growing suspicious of generative AI and its many-thumbed, robot-voiced nostrums.
Yet while there’s not much to be done about the RTX 5090 costing at minimum £1939 / $1999, hundreds more than the infamously spenny RTX 4090, its suite of more purely performance-focused artificial intelligence tools is – dare I say it – quite neat. These range from Multi Frame Generation (MFG), which is basically DLSS 3 frame gen but up to twice as fast, to DLSS 4’s general upscaling enhancements and even the ability to apply newer DLSS versions to older games. All this will come to the rest of the RTX 50 series as well, with some trickling down to the enter RTX range, so maybe the RTX 5090 is best understood not as a practical GPU purchase in itself but as a Picadilly Square-filling advert for its more affordable siblings can do.
Read more
articles.title: Nvidia GeForce RTX 5090 review: the ultimate DLSS 4 billboard

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
In a dramatic turn of events, the Royal Shakespeare Company have finally acknowledged that video games are cool and theatre simply does not have enough buttons. They are partnering with a game studio to create a playable adaptation of Macbeth from the point of view of someone examining Lady Macbeth's computer for dirt. Lili looks a lot like the interactive drama popularised by Sam Barlow's Her Story and Telling Lies. Except this has the added twist of being set in contemporary Iran. The game "will see Macbeth’s witches reimagined as hackers, with surveillance cameras and cyber-infiltration putting the player at the heart of the story..." Witchy hackers? I'm in.
Read more
articles.title: Lili is a retelling of Macbeth set in a "neo-noir" Iran that re-casts the three witches as hackers

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
Some eager beavers who bought the GeForce RTX 4090 at launch were, quite infamously, rewarded for their investment with a defective power adapter, one that that could melt the plastic in their £1679 graphics card like it was Ronald Lacey’s face. Nvidia reckon that won’t be an issue with for the imminent RTX 5090 and RTX 5080, though, even with the former’s drastically increased 575W power limit.
Read more
articles.title: Nvidia are pretty sure the RTX 50 series GPUs won’t melt like the RTX 4090 did

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
You'd think Talha and Jack Co would have earned themselves a nice custard cream and a sit down after having just released Judero last September, but they're back already with a crowdfunder for Mashina - a robo-stuffed adventure where you'll "Dig, build, discover and mend in a chill, stop-motion world." Now I think about, you could probably eat quite a lot of custard creams in five months, although less so if you were using your hands to build model robots. Have a trailer. It's got robots in it.
Read more
articles.title: Mashina is a chill stop-motion adventure with friendly robots from the Judero Team

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Back in December, a bunch of cool games had the extreme impoliteness to sneak onto digital shelves while we were losing our hair, souls and marbles covering various gaming award shows. One of those games was Escape From Castle Matsumoto - which can be excused, admittedly, because it's a game about ninjas, and we expect ninjas to be sneaky.
  
Read more
articles.title: Here's a free 80s-style ninja heist game where you race in splitscreen to loot a daimyo's castle

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
The creators of All Will Fall are pariahs, as far as I'm concerned. You should warn your children to avoid them. If you encounter them in the street, you should jerk away with a muttered oath, making a sign to avert evil spirits - for these are the scumbags who've decided to develop a city-building game in which all the buildings and building materials are subject to realworld physics. A city-building game that takes place on small, post-apocalyptic islands, where the only way to expand is upward.
"Playing Jenga with human lives" is how they summarise it, the wastrels. Here's a trailer.

 Read more
articles.title: What kind of diseased mind makes a city builder with actual building physics

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Celeste and Towerfall creators Extremely OK Games have announced the cancellation of their pixelart exploration platformer Earthblade, in what studio director Maddy Thorson calls a "huge, heartbreaking, and yet relieving failure". The decision to call it quits follows a bust-up within the development team, though this isn't, apparently, why they pulled the plug. Thorson and programmer Noel Berry have found making something "bigger and better" than Celeste exhausting, and have decided to work on smaller projects in future.
 Read more
articles.title: Celeste devs cancel lush platformer Earthblade to focus on smaller-scale projects

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Letošní únorové vydání kancelářského balíku LibreOffice přináší desítky vylepšení ve všech aplikacích i společného základu balíku. Lépe pracuje s většími dokumenty či usnadňuje práci lidem s horším zrakem.
articles.title: LibreOffice 25.2 přináší ODF 1.4 či vylepšené rozhraní a podporu OOXML

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Dnes se seznámíme s unikátní vlastností Raspberry Pi Pico. Tyto jednodeskové mikropočítače obsahují PIO (Programmable IO), což jsou bloky ovládající vstupně-výstupní piny (GPIO). Ty se chovají jako samostatně programovatelné procesory.
articles.title: Programovatelné IO na mikrořadičích RP2040 v Raspberry Pi Pico

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Na setkání CSNOG 2025 se odborníci zaměřili na inovace v monitorování sítí, vizualizaci, automatizaci datových center a evoluci k SRv6. Diskutovalo se také o významu merchant siliconů a statistikách.
articles.title: Monitoring, vizualizace a automatizace sítí, hlavní témata z CSNOG 2025

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Bařina)
articles.description: Ukážeme si použití knihovny GStreamer, která je postavena nad knihovnou GLib. Předvedeme si vytváření instancí elementů, jejich zařazení do pipeline, následnou správu smyčky zpráv a plugin dekódující video.
articles.title: Multimediální frameworky: použití knihovny GStreamer

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jiří Sluka)
articles.description: Pravidelná sonda do světa software. Podíváme se na terminálový nástroj pro sledování využití GPU, vyzkoušíme si Time Machine pro ZFS a Btrfs a nakonec si představíme SSH klienta s pokročilými funkcemi.
articles.title: Softwarová sklizeň (5. 2. 2025): sledujte statistiky využití svého GPU

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Začneme se seznamovat se SIMD instrukcemi pro platformu 80×86, které jsou souhrnně nazývány, i když ne zcela přesně, vektorové instrukce. První na řadě je technologie MMX.
articles.title: SIMD instrukce na platformě 80×86: nepřímý důsledek platnosti Mooreova zákona

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: O víkendu proběhl v Bruselu FOSDEM 2025. Jde o tradiční setkání open-source komunity, kde se setkali vývojáři, nadšenci a odborníci z celého světa. Ve fotogalerii přinášíme pohled na celou akci.
articles.title: FOSDEM 2025 v obrazech: největší setkání open-source nadšenců v Evropě

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: ČD - Telematika)
articles.description: Podíváme se na malware Aquabot zneužívající zranitelnost v telefonech Mitel, AI chatboty které pomáhají vytvářet malware, phishingovou kampaň cílící na uživatele Amazonu a zásah na populární hackingová fóra.
articles.title: Postřehy z bezpečnosti: když SIP telefony Mitel slouží botnetům

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Společnost Google otevřela zdrojové kódy PebbleOS, operačního systému pro chytré hodinky. Mediální přehrávač VLC připravuje funkci, která díky umělé inteligenci dokáže generovat titulky v reálném čase.
articles.title: Google otevřel PebbleOS, VLC bude díky AI generovat titulky

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Díky dotacím EU se můžete školit v IT sektoru skoro zadarmo. Za kurzy digitálního vzdělávání si zaplatíte jen 18 % z ceny, zbylou část uhradí EU přes program Jsem v kurzu. Můžete získat až 50 000 korun.
articles.title: Získejte 50 000 korun na kurzy dalšího vzdělávání, ať jste zaměstnanec nebo OSVČ

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Byla vydána verze 24.10 linuxové distribuce OpenWrt, která se zaměřuje na běh na síťových prvcích. Od vydání předchozí verze 23.05 uběhl déle než rok a vývojáři od té doby zaslali přes 5400 commitů.
articles.title: OpenWrt 24.10 přináší linuxové jádro 6.6

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Možná jste si doposud mysleli, že soubory PDF jsou tvořeny pouze statickými dokumenty, ale formát PDF překvapivě podporuje JavaScript s vlastní standardní knihovnou. Moderní prohlížeče (Chromium, Firefox) ji implementují jako součást svých PDF enginů.
articles.title: Linux běžící uvnitř PDF prostřednictvím emulátoru RISC-V

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Základní deska DeepComputing RISC-V, kterou Framework oznámil loni pro své 13palcové notebooky, je nyní k dispozici za 199 dolarů. Pokud již máte notebook Framework Laptop 13 se základní deskou Intel nebo AMD, lze základní desku vyměnit.
articles.title: Základní deska RISC-V pro notebook Framework 13 je nyní k dispozici

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Pravděpodobně jste už někdy slyšeli někoho se ptát: „Ale dokážete na tom spustit Doom?“ To proto, že spuštění Dooma na nejpodivnějších platformách a zařízeních se stalo mezi vývojáři zábavnou výzvou. Nyní se někomu podařilo něco opravdu překvapivého: spustil Dooma na adaptéru Apple Lightning na HDMI.
articles.title: Vývojář spustil Dooma na adaptéru z Lightning na HDMI

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Společnost Microsoft bude firemním zákazníkům v prvním roce účtovat 61 dolarů za každé zařízení, které bude po ukončení podpory nadále dostávat bezpečnostní aktualizace systému Windows 10. Poplatek se navíc každý následující rok zdvojnásobí.
articles.title: Rozšířené bezpečnostní aktualizace Windows 10 budou stát od 61 dolarů za počítač

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Google chce komerční kvantové výpočetní aplikace uvolnit do pěti let, čímž zpochybňuje předpověď společnosti Nvidia, která počítá s dvacetiletým horizontem. Předpokládáme, že do pěti let uvidíme reálné aplikace, které jsou možné pouze na kvantových počítačích, uvedl v prohlášení zakladatel a vedoucí oddělení Google Quantum AI Hartmut Neven.
articles.title: Google předpokládá komerční kvantové výpočetní aplikace do pěti let

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Ve čtvrtém čtvrtletí roku 2024 společnost AMD poprvé v historii překonala Intel v prodeji do datacenter. Tržby společnosti AMD ve zmíněném čtvrtletí dosáhly 7,658 miliardy dolarů, což představuje meziroční nárůst o 24 %. Hrubá marže společnosti dosáhla 51 %, zatímco čistý zisk činil 482 milionů USD.
articles.title: AMD poprvé překonává Intel v prodejích do datových center

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Vývojáři nástroje Curl v prosinci oznámili, že upouští od svého backendu „Hyper“ napsaném v Rustu. Důvodem je především malá poptávka a nedostatek zájmu vývojářů o tento experimentální kód. Dnes vyšla verze Curl 8.12, která Hyper z kódu vypustila.
articles.title: Vyšel Curl 8.12 s odstraněným backendem Hyper napsaným v Rustu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Další z novinek, které přinese Mesa 25.1, bude implementace podpory hardwarové akcelerace formátu H.265/HEVC skrze Direct3D 12. Kód pochopitelně připravili inženýři Microsoftu v rámci prací na linuxové podpoře pro WSL2, tedy Windows Subsystem for Linux.
articles.title: Akcelerace kódování HEVC v Mesa nově i pro Direct3D 12 s WSL2

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Dvě významné novinky byly začleněny do projektu FFmpeg. První z nich je implementace počáteční podpory dekódování videa skrze AMD Advanced Media Framework (AMF), která rozšiřuje již dříve implementovanou podporu kódování videa skrze toto rozhraní.
articles.title: FFmpeg dostává dekodér s AMD AMF a podporu FSR upscalingu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Keycloak je Identity provider (IDP) a Single Sign On (SSO). Umožní vám spravovat uživatele na jednom místě a vytvořit single sign on – jediné místo pro přihlášení uživatelů. Už nemusíte psát jméno a heslo do každé aplikace zvlášť. Připravili jsme pro vás školení Keycloak SSO, které proběhne 10. února a zúčastnit se ho můžete online.
articles.title: Keycloak SSO: efektivní správa uživatelů a bezpečné přihlášení (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Ve stejnou dobu jako Firefox 135, přichází i beta verze následného vydání, které je plánováno na začátek března. Majitelé Radeonů či různých integrovaných řešení od AMD se mohou těšit, příští verze Firefoxu přinese podporu hardwarové akcelerace dekódování videa pro GPU AMD na Linuxu. Vedle toho už víme, že obdobně pro macOS bude připravena hardwarová akcelerace pro přehrávání obsahu ve formátu H.265/HEVC.
articles.title: Firefox 136 za měsíc přinese hardwarovou akceleraci videa pro Radeony na Linuxu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Automatické vyplňování údajů platebních karet pro všechny uživatele Firefoxu je jednou z novinek verze 135.0. Dále je už všem uživatelům k dispozici i AI chatbot (jde o volitelnou věc dostupnou v postranní liště či ve Firefox Labs). Dále stopětatřicítka vynucuje po webech transparentnost u certifikátů (týká se těch, které byly vystaveny s Mozilla Root CA). Postupně je uživatelům aktivován mechanismus revokace certifikátů CRLite.
articles.title: Firefox 135: vyplňování údajů o platebních kartách či lepší překlady stránek

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Nová verze aktualizačního nástroje pro všemožné firmwary je venku a s ní i podpora více čteček otisků prstů typu ELAN či podpora aktualizace firmawrů pro Star Labs StarLite Magnetic Keyboard. Nová verze fwupd 2.0.5 také umí emulaci / zařízení pro čtení EFI kláves a podporu přeskakování testů zařízení dle architektury CPU.
articles.title: Fwupd 2.0.5 vylepšuje podporu čteček otisků prstů, na Intel Arc ještě vyčkejme

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Z generace Intel Battlemage jsou mezi velkými kartami v tuto chvíli na trhu dva modely, B580 a B570. Víme jistě, že Intel plánuje další, což potvrzuje změna v kódu v rámci Mesa, která přidává nová PCI device ID nad rámec již existujících, z nichž jedno nese přímo shodný popisek BMG G21 a celkový počet tohoto ID tak vzrůstá na pět.
articles.title: Tři nová ID pro karty typu Intel Battlemage

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Fyzikální ústav Akademie věd ČR se stal první institucí, jejíž připojení do páteřní sítě CESNET (e-INFRA CZ) bylo povýšeno na 400 Gb/s. Původní připojení Fyzikálního ústavu AV ČR o kapacitě 200 Gb/s před povýšením již kvůli svému 70% zatížení nevyhovovalo náročným požadavkům na přenos dat, uvádí zpráva organizace CESNET.
articles.title: Fyzikální ústav Akademie věd ČR je připojen do sítě CESNET rychlostí 400 Gb/s

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Na webu komunitního setkání CSNOG 2025 jsou dostupné prezentace v PDF, jejich videozáznamy a fotografie z lednové akce ve Zlíně.
articles.title: Záznamy přednášek ze setkání CSNOG 2025 jsou dostupné online

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: bkralik)
articles.description: Je vaším koníčkem technika? Zajímá vás elektronika, software či věda? Pak je tu pro vás jako každý měsíc Virtuální Bastlírna, na které si můžete s dalšími nadšenci popovídat tak, jako byste seděli společně u piva, avšak online z pohodlí svého domova. Odpadá tak trmácení se sychravým zimním městem plným ucpaných ulic.
articles.title: Virtuální Bastlírna vol. 47: nepotkal vás také repasovaný disk?

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Společnost OpenAI překvapivě dnes oznámila Deep Research, kterým reaguje na čínský LLM DeepSeek-R1, který se objevil asi před týdnem. Deep Research má být schopen víceúrovňového vyhledávání na internetu a tím má být schopen řešit složitější úlohy, které by lidem trvaly hodiny.
articles.title: OpenAI vrací úder a oznamuje Deep Research

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Nadace Linux Foundation minulý týden zveřejnila článek o amerických sankcích OFAC (Office of Foreign Assets Control) v open source. Ty striktně omezují…
articles.title: Americké sankce OFAC a open source

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Prohlížeče založené na Chromiu (takže i Edge) budou mít ve Windows zvývšený kontrast písma. To se podle Microsoftu projeví pozitivně na jeho čitelnosti, hlavně u obrázkového písma. V Edge se upravoval vzhled písma již v roce 2021.
articles.title: Prohlížeče Chromium budou mít ve Windows kontrastnější písmo

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Sdružení CZ.NIC, správce české národní domény, vydalo Domain Report za rok 2024. Shrnutí nabízí klíčová statistická fakta o stavu a vývoji domény .CZ, která je primárně využívána subjekty v Česku (91 %).
articles.title: CZ.NIC vydal Domain Report za rok 2024

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Mozilla koupila firmu Fakespot v roce 2023. Ta se zabývá detekcí textů generovaných velkými jazykovými modely (LLM). Příkladem použití jsou například generované pozitivní recenze v internetových obchodech.
articles.title: Mozilla Fakespot k detekci textů napsaných AI

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Linux je v síťovém prostředí jako doma, může zastat prakticky všechny potřebné role od směrovače (router), přes DHCP, DNS až po souborový server Samba pro Microsoft Windows. Přijďte se to všechno naučit na naše online školení s názvem Linux: správa počítačové sítě, které je dotované Úřadem práce.
articles.title: Linux a správa počítačové sítě, dotované školení pro každého

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Certifikační autorita Let's Encrypt v současné době poskytuje certifikáty TLS více než 550 milionům webových stránek. Jen za poslední rok se navíc toto číslo zvýšilo o 42 % a každou hodinu se nyní vystaví více než 340 000 certifikátů. Aby bylo možné takový provoz zvládnout, je pro uživatele stanoveno několik technických limitů.
articles.title: Let's Encrypt má nový systém stavěný na miliardu aktivních certifikátů

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Přehled lednových vydání Jaderných novin: stav vydání jádra, citáty týdne a seznam článků týkajících se jádra.
articles.title: Jaderné noviny – přehled za leden 2025

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: AI bude hrát prim v roce 2025 i u poskytovatelů finančních služeb a pojišťovnictví. Sodíkové baterie potřebují dalších technologické průlomy, aby mohly konkurovat lithiu. Spuštění aplikace DeepSeek by mělo být budíčkem pro americké firmy. Chytré kamery pomohou sektoru automotive k vyšší spolehlivosti výroby. Pure Storage v ČR svá úložiště nejen vyvíjí – v pardubickém Foxconnu probíhá i výroba. Generativní AI a LLM: (R)evoluce v umělé inteligenci?
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Sodíkové baterie potřebují dalších technologické průlomy, aby mohly konkurovat lithiu

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description: Kupte buď levný klíč na Windows 11 (OEM) nebo Office a jejich bundly nebo další software jako antimalware, hry atd. na tržišti Goodoffer24.com je kde toto všechno k dispozici. Žádné zkušební verze, ale doživotní licence!
articles.title: Levné klíče na Windows 11 a Office včetně bundlů a další software

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 5/2025

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Kvark gluonové plazma může existovat i v podobě malých kapek. Vrstvy grafenu by se mohly spojovat pomocí rotaxanů. Saturnin-1: největší fungující česká družice ve vesmíru.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Ve vzorcích z asteroidu Bennu našli všech pět dusíkatých bází z nukleových kyselin

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Acer představuje nové notebooky TravelMate. Bezpečí je pro firmy při zavádění cloudových technologií nejvyšší prioritou. Adaptivní feroelektrické materiály slibují energeticky úsporné superpočítače. Threat Insights Report: rozkvět sad malware-by-numbers. Jak optimalizovat vyhledávače pro umělou inteligenci.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Jak optimalizovat vyhledávače pro umělou inteligenci

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 4/2025

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Kolik černých děr se ukrývá? Supervenuše: Webbův dalekohled potvrdil nový typ exoplanet. Bezpilotní letoun Toyoty začne létat jako taxi v Dubaji. Superpočítače Barbora a Karolina se chystají do důchodu.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Diamantová membrána má vylepšit chlazení v elektromobilech i dobíjení baterií

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Výzvy spojené s nařízením DORA. České nemocnice nemají dostatečně zajištěnou kyberbezpečnost. USA omezí vývoz čipů v oblasti AI, dotkne se to i Česka. Letos lze čekat nás rozvoj AI agentů, AI PC i změny v datových centrech. Serverová virtualizace od Huawei podle DCS.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: USA omezí vývoz čipů v oblasti AI, dotkne se to i Česka

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 3/2025

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Top 10 ve fyzice za rok 2024: Laserové chlazení pozitronia. AI jazykové modely mohou efektivně vytvářet konzistentní příběhy. Studium fotonů umožnilo navrhnout novou metodu detekce axionů.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Relativistický elektronový paprsek by mohl dostat sondu k Alfa Centauri za 40 let

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána (𝕏) lednová aktualizace aneb nová verze 1.97 editoru zdrojových kódů Visual Studio Code (Wikipedie). Přehled novinek i s náhledy a animovanými gify v poznámkách k vydání. Ve verzi 1.97 vyšlo také VSCodium, tj. komunitní sestavení Visual Studia Code bez telemetrie a licenčních podmínek Microsoftu.
articles.title: Visual Studio Code a VSCodium 1.97

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Hra Doom může běžet (𝕏, Mastodon) i v převodníku Apple Lightning na HDMI. Ukázka na YouTube.
articles.title: Hra Doom v převodníku Apple Lightning na HDMI

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Nedávno se povedlo do pdf souborů vložit Tetris a DOOM a po otevření příslušného pdf souboru v na Chromiu založeném webovém prohlížeči vybranou hru přímo v pdf spustit. LinuxPDF ukazuje, že do pdf lze vložit také RISC-V emulátor a rozběhnout Linux.
articles.title: LinuxPDF, RISC-V emulátor a Linux běžící v pdf souboru

articles.author: Fluttershy, yay!
articles.description: Kancelářský balík LibreOffice byl vydán ve verzi 25.2. Podrobnosti v poznámkách k vydání.
articles.title: LibreOffice 25.2

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána nová stabilní major verze 24.10 linuxové distribuce primárně určené pro routery a vestavěné systémy OpenWrt (Wikipedie). Jedná se o nástupce předchozí major verze 23.05. Přehled novinek v poznámkách k vydání. Podporováno je více než 1970 zařízení. Samozřejmě včetně OpenWrt One. Linux byl povýšen z verze 5.15 na verzi 6.6.
articles.title: OpenWrt 24.10

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána nová verze 6.12 živé linuxové distribuce Tails (The Amnesic Incognito Live System), jež klade důraz na ochranu soukromí uživatelů a anonymitu. Přináší důležité bezpečnostní opravy díky bezpečnostnímu auditu od společností Radically Open Security. Tor Browser byl povýšen na verzi 14.0.5. Thunderbird na verzi 128.6.0. Další změny v příslušném seznamu.
articles.title: Tails 6.12

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: astroterm je počítačové planetárium v terminálu. Aktuální verze je 1.0.7.
articles.title: astroterm, počítačové planetárium v terminálu

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Databáze DuckDB (Wikipedie) byla vydána ve verzi 1.2.0. S kódovým názvem Histrionicus (kačka strakatá). Z novinek lze vypíchnout, že například 🦆 může být nově použita jako vícebajtový oddělovač sloupců. 😂
articles.title: DuckDB 1.2.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Google Chrome 133 byl prohlášen za stabilní. Nejnovější stabilní verze 133.0.6943.53 přináší řadu novinek z hlediska uživatelů i vývojářů. Podrobný přehled v poznámkách k vydání. Opraveno bylo 12 bezpečnostních chyb. Vylepšeny byly také nástroje pro vývojáře.
articles.title: Google Chrome 133

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Novinky v Knot Resolver 6: ochrana před DoS útoky – technické řešení, aktuální příspěvek na blogu zaměstnanců CZ.NIC.
articles.title: Novinky v Knot Resolver 6: ochrana před DoS útoky – technické řešení

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: A year ago I raised attention about crypto-config as a new Ubuntu project for system-wide cryptography configuration. That crypto config tool continues being developed by Canonical engineers for a gradual roll-out into the Ubuntu Linux landscape...
articles.title: Ubuntu's crypto-config Continues Being Developed For Gradual Roll-Out

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Android and Chrome OS already are carrying the VirtIO Media driver as a means of enabling virtualization of host media devices into a guest while now patch review is underway in trying to get VirtIO Media upstreamed in the mainline Linux kernel...
articles.title: VirtIO Media Driver Upstreaming Pursued For Relaying V4L2 Media Devices To Guests

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: After recently re-visiting the AMD EPYC 9005 series AVX-512 performance, I followed up with some fresh SMT benchmarks looking at the performance benefits and power of toggling Simultaneous Multi-Threading on the 5th Gen AMD EPYC "Turin" hardware. Here are some fresh numbers looking at the SMT performance with AMD Zen 5 server processors.
articles.title: SMT Remains Very Advantageous For 5th Gen AMD EPYC Performance

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: While the AMDXDNA driver was merged for the Linux 6.14 kernel for enabling the Ryzen AI NPUs atop a mainline kernel build, there's still the user-space software needed for making use of the neural processing units found in Ryzen AI SoCs. AMD talked more about programming Ryzen AI NPUs last weekend in Belgium at the FOSDEM 2025 developer conference...
articles.title: AMD Talks Up IREE/MLIR Programming For Ryzen AI NPUs

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Intel's software engineers working on the OpenVINO AI toolkit today released OpenVINO 2025.0 that brings support for the much talked about Deepseek models along with other large language models (LLMs), performance improvements to some of the existing model support, and other changes...
articles.title: Intel's OpenVINO 2025.0 Brings Support For Deepseek Models, Better AI Performance

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: LibreOffice 25.2 is out this morning as the newest half-year update to this leading cross-platform, free software office suite...
articles.title: LibreOffice 25.2 Open-Source Office Suite Released With Many Improvements

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Mesa 25.0-rc2 was released yesterday and it's rather boring on the changes, but that's a good thing during this bug fixing phase...
articles.title: Mesa 25.0 Is Trending Well For Release Later This Month

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: With the recent GNU Binutils 2.44 release, one of the changes is worth calling out in its own article: the GNU Gold linker is now officially deprecated and is now being segregated to its own extra Binutils package but risks being removed all together without new developer volunteers stepping up to maintain this linker...
articles.title: GNU Gold Linker Is Deprecated & Will Be Gone For Good Without New Developers

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Red Hat engineer and PipeWire lead developer Wim Taymans presented at FOSDEM 2025 last weekend around the state of the PipeWire project for this integral component to the modern Linux desktop...
articles.title: PipeWire Is Doing An Excellent Job Handling Audio/Video Streams On The Linux Desktop

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The modern Intel "Xe" Linux kernel Direct Rendering Manager (DRM) driver as the clean successor to the i915 driver has been an experimental option for Tigerlake and newer but only for Xe2 graphics (Lunar Lake / Battlemage) and newer is it used by default. But Google at least for their Chromebook use-cases is entertaining the idea of switching over to the Xe driver rather than the long-used i915 kernel driver for Alder Lake era hardware...
articles.title: Google Interested In The Modern Intel Xe Linux Kernel Driver On Alder Lake

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Yesterday I showcased Linux 6.14 Git performance worse than Linux 6.13 and 6.12 in a number of multi-threaded workloads. Due to that initial discover being on the lone AMD EPYC Turin 2P server that is always busy running through new benchmarks for future content as well as I am being persistently short on time and constantly under pressure due to the state of the web/ad industry, I didn't expect to get around to digging deeper into the problem in the near-term. But as I ended up being able to reproduce some of the regressions on a System76 Thelio Major workstation at my desk with the still mighty powerful Ryzen Threadripper 7980X, I was able to turn around a quick bisect...
articles.title: Bisecting The Linux 6.14 Performance Regression With System76 Thelio + AMD Threadripper

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Merged last year for the Linux 6.12 kernel was sched_ext for allowing extensible scheduler possibilities by allowing schedulers to be implemented as eBPF code and dynamically loaded into the kernel. This allows for rapidly developing new schedulers as well as exploring other new possibilities around more intelligent kernel scheduling decisions. Meta, Google, Canonical (Ubuntu), and others have been big proponents of sched_ext and NVIDIA is also increasingly vocalizing their support for these extensible scheduler opportunities...
articles.title: NVIDIA Engineer Talks Up sched_ext Linux Scheduler Possibilities At FOSDEM

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Now that the Linux 6.14 merge window wrapped up this past weekend with the release of Linux 6.14-rc1, here is a recap of all the great new features, hardware enablement, and other improvements to find with this kernel.
articles.title: Linux 6.14 Features Include The AMDXDNA Ryzen AI Driver, NTSYNC, Uncached Buffered I/O & Much More

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: AMD announced today the release of Schola 1.0 as an open-source reinforcement learning library that is being made available under an MIT license and as part of their GPUOpen software collection for helping game developers...
articles.title: AMD Announces Open-Source "Schola" Library For Reinforcement Learning

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: One of the set of patches for the Linux kernel that we have been looking forward to but that wasn't wrapped up in time for the recent Linux v6.14 merge window was the work enabling use of the AMD INVLPGB instruction on Zen 3 CPUs and newer for broadcast TLB invalidation. This can lead to a nice performance bump in some workloads while the eighth iteration of those patches were posted overnight...
articles.title: AMD Broadcast TLB Invalidation Patches For Linux Updated, Intel RAR Eyed Next

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The Linux Foundation by way of their LF Energy initiative announced today the release of SEAPATH 1.0, a security-hardened real-time hypervisor...
articles.title: Linux Foundation Announces The SEAPATH 1.0 Hypervisor

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Red Hat engineer Anirban Sinha presented at FOSDEM 2025 last weekend in Brussels on F-UKI, a new project being worked on at Red Hat as part of the confidential computing push for loading guest firmware within a Unified Kernel Image (UKI) for confidential VMs...
articles.title: Red Hat Developing "F-UKI" As Their Newest Open-Source Project

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Google engineer Eric Biggers is known for some of his great crypto performance optimization patches to benefit the Linux kernel and his most recent patch series is yielding some very tantalizing results for AMD Zen 5 processors whether it be the Ryzen 9000 series, Ryzen AI 300 series, or EPYC 9005 server processors...
articles.title: New Linux Patches Yield Up To 3.3x Faster AES-CTR Performance On AMD Zen 5 CPUs

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Back in December was word that cURL would be dropping its "Hyper" Rust HTTP back-end due to little demand and lack of developer interest for that experimental code. The cURL 8.12 release is out today with Hyper stripped out...
articles.title: cURL 8.12 Released With Its Rust Hyper Backend Removed

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The GNOME Mutter 48 compositor beta is now available for testing as part of this week's GNOME 48 beta milestone...
articles.title: GNOME Mutter 48 Beta Released With HDR Bits, Gdctl Utility

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: While having missed the mark last week for making it into this quarter's Mesa 25.0 release, merged for Q2's Mesa 25.1 release by Microsoft engineers are some enhancements to the Direct3D 12 video encode capabilities...
articles.title: Microsoft Lands Direct3D 12 Video Encode Improvements For HEVC In Mesa 25.1

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: As somewhat of an annual tradition for the FOSDEM conference, Daniel Kiper of Oracle presented a status update on the GRUB bootloader. As one of the GRUB maintainers he offers great insight to activity around this most common Linux bootloader...
articles.title: GRUB Continues Working Toward Its Next Release In 2025

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: With Linux 6.14-rc1 released I have begun trying out the new development kernel on a few systems locally. At least for high core count hardware tested thus far, Linux 6.14 at the moment during this early testing phase is sporting some performance regressions within some multi-threaded workloads.
articles.title: An Early Performance Regression Hitting Highly Threaded Workloads On Linux 6.14-rc1

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: With Firefox 135 released, Firefox 136 is now in beta. Most notable with this next iteration of the Mozilla Firefox web browser is finally enabling hardware video acceleration by default for AMD GPUs on Linux...

articles.author: Joseph Luster
articles.description:
Who doesn't love a good roadmap? Rabbit & Bear Studios, the folks behind Suikoden spiritual successor Eiyuden Chronicle: Hundred Heroes, just laid out one of their own with dates for three upcoming story expansions.


Players won't have to wait too long for the updates, each focusing on one of three main characters. It all starts on February 27 with The Chapter of Marisa, a Marisa-centric expansion that spins a yarn about the character's encounter with an enchanted girl. What happens when the pair set out to dig through the secrets of the "Child of the Rune," and what sinister forces are at work behind the scenes?


After that, we have The Chapter of Seign to look forward to on March 13, tasking Seign with handling an issue within the Galdean empire. The Chapter of Markus closes things out on April 3, as Markus, Carrie, and Nowa investigate the strange realm beyond a newly unlocked teleportation gateway.


Image via 505 Games


All three chapters will be available on PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X|S, Nintendo Switch, and PC. If you fancy continuing your adventure over the next few months, the story expansions will be priced at $7.99 each.


It's also worth noting that, according to the latest Kickstarter update, these scenarios are the last parts of the game that Suikoden and Eiyuden Chronicles creator Yoshitaka Murayama worked on directly. The industry veteran passed away on February 6, 2024, after dealing with "complications with an ongoing illness." Maruyama was very enthusiastic about the project, so it will no doubt be worth seeing how his final pieces of input shaped the DLC to come. 

The post Eiyuden Chronicle: Hundred Heroes sets dates for trio of story expansions appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Eiyuden Chronicle: Hundred Heroes sets dates for trio of story expansions

articles.author: Arka Sarkar
articles.description:
If you've been eagerly looking to play Avowed at 60fps at launch, there is some good news and some bad news.


Obsidian's upcoming project will be able to run at 60fps at launch on the Xbox Series X. That said, the performance you might get could fall way below your expectations if the game's director, Carrie Patel, is to be believed.


Avowed will finally run at 60 fps at launch on Xbox Series X


Talking on the MinnMax podcast, Patel said players can play the game on 60fps.



"You can get up to 60[fps]"




This news will be huge for those who will be playing on the Xbox Series X. Last time, Obsidian made it clear that Avowed will only run at 30fps at launch on the Xbox Series X. This news did disappoint some, as the Series X is the beefier console (compared to Series S).




Back then, the devs claimed that the game had become "a lot juicier" in development. This was cited as the main reason behind the limitation on frames per second. Something has definitely changed since, and players will be able to access higher fps, but there's a catch.



"You gotta accept a little jank to do something fun and creative, I think."




Hence, it's safe to assume that running the game at 60fps might be possible, but it might feel unoptimized. That said, it's still better that Series X users will at least have the feature to try and enjoy Avowed with higher fps. Any optimization issues are likely going to be sorted by Obsidian post-launch.


The upcoming title will be released on February 18 after a long delay (it was originally scheduled to launch towards the end of 2024). If you choose to purchase the Premium Edition, you can start your journey on February 13. The game will also be available from day one on the Xbox Game Pass Ultimate.

The post Avowed can run at 60fps at launch on Xbox Series X but developers say expect some “jank” appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Avowed can run at 60fps at launch on Xbox Series X but developers say expect some “jank”

EA FC 25 Future Stars Team 2 release date

articles.author: Christine Choi
articles.description:
Most 5-star characters in Genshin Impact are limited, meaning they’re only obtainable during specific event banners. However, a select few are relegated to the standard pool, giving players a chance to pull the character even when they’re not featured. Is Yumemizuki Mizuki fated to be limited or standard?


Mizuki will be a standard 5-star character


HoYoverse confirmed during a version preview that Yumemizuki Mizuki will be added to the standard 5-star character pool. This means her upcoming banner in the first half of Version 5.4 will likely be the only dedicated event banner for Mizuki. After her banner comes to an end, you’ll have a small chance to obtain her on other limited character banners, on the standard banner, or on Chronicled Wish banners.


Screenshot by Destructoid


Does this mean Mizuki will be bad?


Those who were around during the Dehya debacle might be anxious at this news. Standard 5-star characters range from fairly decent (Tighnari, Jean) to outright terrible (Dehya, Qiqi). Being added to the standard pool is a portent of mediocrity. Dehya, the most recent character to make her way to the standard banner, is notorious for being particularly weak.


Mizuki will likely never reach the power level of Mavuika or Neuvillette, but she doesn’t seem to be bad either. From what we’ve seen so far, Mizuki will have a unique kit, be easy to build, and work with many teammates. If you like Mizuki and want to play a Swirl DPS, then Mizuki will be a perfectly fine pull.


That being said, unless you really like Mizuki, I recommend holding off on her limited event banner. Save your precious Primogems for a character you love, and you might accidentally get Mizuki along the way. Emphasis on “might.” It took me more than two years of playing Genshin Impact to get my first Mona.

The post Is Yumemizuki Mizuki coming to the standard banner in Genshin Impact? appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Is Yumemizuki Mizuki coming to the standard banner in Genshin Impact?

articles.author: Arka Sarkar
articles.description:
The outcome of most quests in Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 will decide how the story evolves, and you'll want to pay strong attention to the points of no return.


The points of no return represent certain stages in the main campaign from where you won't be able to backtrack. In simpler words, any side quests left incomplete till this stage will remain as such, so you must finish them before reaching the stages.


Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 points of no return explained


The two points of no return are decided by the regions available in Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2. The first point of no return is available in the Trosky region. It's tied with the Necessary Evil quest, which is part of the main storyline.


Before you begin this quest, make sure to complete every side mission available in the Trosky region. Of course, you don't need to complete all of them, but any you leave out will remain like that. Not only will you miss out on the completion rewards, but a part of the lore will also remain out of your access on that particular save.


Image via Deep Silver


The second point of no return is part of the Kuttenburg region, and it appears before you start the Oratores quest. Like Necessary Evil, Oratores is part of the main questline as well. Similar to the previous one, you must finish all side quests available at the Kuttenburg region. Any that you leave unfinished will remain so in your playthrough.


If you're focusing entirely on the main campaign, you'll be able to complete the game quicker. However, you'll be losing out on a lot of fun, as the lore really kicks strong after the first few quests. You'll also progress slower as completing the side missions will help you to gain more in-game experience and other valuable resources like Groschen.

The post All points of no return in Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: All points of no return in Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2
